I recommend that facilities asked for be extended to Bahrain petroleum Company. - BR1TCC dUI - No. 795-S. British Reaiuei t o^ A Oon^ ulate-Gensral^ Bueliixt, * the 25th October 1943. Copy forwarded, with compliments, to l.His Majesty’s Secretary of State for India, The India Office, IOHDCH. with copy of telegram under reference. 2 .The Political Agent, BAHRAIN.> Telegram From To Rep eated Ho • 720. ■Dated and 3. Political Agent, Bahrain. Political Resident, Bushire. H.M.Anbastador, Cairo for M.S.3, received 24th October 1943. ‘ •''•A 0 I H O Q ii Bahrain Petroleum Company who are endeavouring to import commissariat stores frem Australia have been informed by Australian Government that all goods must be covered by import licences recommended by U.E.S.C. A.I.C.C., Ira^i Railways, N.A.A.F.I. etc. have been granted exemption from this rule. i request that M.S.S.C. in order to facilitate the arrival of much needed supplies should extend the exemption to Bahrain Petroleum Comxs ny and inform the Australian Government accordingly. - POLITICAL - RHL.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 6470/43 'Stores from Australia for Bahrain Petroleum Company'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a request from the Political Agent, Bahrain, that the Middle East Supply Centre grant an exemption on import licence requirements to the Bahrain Petroleum Company, in order to facilitate the importing of supplies from Australia.
